result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fernando Ontiveros

records.addlTxt:
2:41 PM Defendant Fernando Ontiveros appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Fernando Ontiveros.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR430 tracking with 22CF45:
Atty Watts states that parties are waiting on blood results.  Atty Burdon agrees and states that blood will not be back until around March.

BY THE COURT:  Set another status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Fernando Ontiveros appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Fernando Ontiveros. 
22TR430 tracking with 22CF45:
Atty Watts states that blood results have not been received yet so there is no offer yet.  Atty Burdon responds.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
AMENDED from a $1,000 cash bond to a signature bond:  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

2:50 PM Defendant Fernando Ontiveros appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Saralinda Watts appeared in person.
2022TR000430 tracking with 22CF45:
Atty Watts states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

Atty Watts states that the defendant is unable to pay the bond and also has a warrant status in Sauk County which will be taken care of tomorrow.
Atty Juech objects to the bond modification request.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with same conditions.

Atty Watts states that the defendant will waive time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:32 PM Defendant Fernando Ontiveros appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and does qualify for Public Defender, he has Atty Sarah Watts.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $2,000 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
